verbs.description: bewater (third-person singular simple present bewaters, present participle bewatering, simple past and past participle bewatered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To water about or all over; cover, douse, or fill with water; make wet; water; hydrate.
examples: For ten days my wife and I fed this mile, every two hours by day, and three by night, wi'h drops of cow's milk, sugared and bewatered.
